history.content: Yes, only if you have completed the EECS upper division and 45 CoE Tech Unit requirements.

children.subject:
From ESS email:

"Beginning Fall 2016, if you are taking a technical course that cannot be used to fulfill any requirement for your major, you may elect to take the course on a pass/no pass (P/NP) basis if you choose the P/NP option by the end of the fifth week of classes. Keep in mind that many COE majors include a minimum number of technical elective units or engineering units, so if the course you are taking can count toward those unit requirements, you must take it for a letter grade. Please check with your adviser if you are unsure if the course can count toward your major requirements. 

This policy is effective Fall 2016. There will be no retroactive changes to grading option for courses completed prior to Fall 2016."
What if we only have 1 of the 45 CoE Tech Units left to complete. Then, in one semester, can we take an upper division CS course for a letter grade and one upper division CS course as P/NP?

history.content: Are EECS students allowed to P/NP Upper Division CS Courses if they've completed all of their requirements? For example, if I wanted to take CS189 but not stress to much about the grade (taking with the goal of simply learning), is taking it P/NP allowed?
history.subject: Taking Upper Division CS Courses as P/NP?
